definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.chinese: 听确双方意见后再下断语。

sentences.english: I must not decide on my own performance.
sentences.chinese: 我当做不能自己下断语。

sentences.english: This paper gives a solution to the same kind of questions by applying the popularized conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 借助一个推广的断语，介绍一类问题的通用解法。

sentences.english: I know that he can't deliver without basis thus of break language, be eager to the continuation that to listen to him.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他不会凭空发这样的断语，急于要听他的下文。

sentences.english: Other visionaries say the same about the future of corporations.
sentences.chinese: 其他幻想家也为未来的公司下了同样的断语。

sentences.english: The assertion is known as the closed graph theorem for Hilbert spaces.
sentences.chinese: 这个断语被称为希耳伯特空间的闭图象定理。

definition: the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to come true/to come about as predicted/to be fulfilled
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
divination based on the eight characters of one's birth date
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
